intro: Aureolaria pectinata subsp. transcedens, commonly known as the Transcendent Goldenweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its basal rosette of lanceolate, hairy leaves. The plant produces showy, yellowish-orange flowers in clusters during the summer months. Its hairy stems and leaves are adapted to arid environments, aiding in water conservation. It is often found in rocky soils and open habitats, contributing to local biodiversity.
